original_title: Sri Lanka shares gain in mid-day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day trade pushed up by the bank and financial industries, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index was up 1.06 percent or 97.33 points to 9,313.82, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.92 percent or 24.32 points to 2,659.13
The market started gaining after the Central bank policy rate cut and falling in the inflation rate stimulating buying interest and driving the sentiment up, analysts said.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Vallible One, Sampath Bank and Richard Pieris. (Colombo/June15/2023)
